intro: Randia gaudichaudii, commonly known as the Gaudichaud's randia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Brazil and the Caribbean. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pink flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Randia gaudichaudii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering habits.
